laboratory_examinations.findings: Decreased amplitude of compound muscle action potentials (CMAP) in both peroneal nerves; motor nerve conduction velocities normal; F-wave latencies absent or mildly prolonged; H reflex could not be elicited bilaterally.
Active fibrillation potentials, positive waves, neurogenic polyphasic waves in right anterior tibialis muscle.
58 cells (18 neutrophils and 17 lymphocytes), glucose 80 mg/100 mL, protein 60 mg/100 mL.

laboratory_examinations.procedure_name: Serum hemagglutinin inhibition for West Nile virus (WNV) antibodies
laboratory_examinations.findings: Negative on admission and days 7, 12, and 19; Positive on day 36 with titers 1:2,560.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Titers increased from 1:10 on admission to 1:2,560 on Day 36.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Day 5 showed questionable nonenhancing hyperintensity in central pons, decreased ADC values in hyperintense areas; Day 13 showed new lesions in both thalami, increased T2 signal.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: New nonenhancing lesions appeared on day 13.
